sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Almost 500 children have been killed and over 1,000 injured since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They stress that the figures are incomplete because of the difficulty gathering data in areas occupied by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Just today, an infant and a 12-year-old boy died in Russian shelling in the Kherson region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Last month, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights reported that over 9,000 civilians have been killed and 16,000 wounded since the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At this moment in time, 7.5 million children in Ukraine are in grave danger of physical harm, severe emotional distress and displacement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Air strikes and explosions have damaged essential services like schools and hospitals, warn NGOs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A shelter here in Maui, Hawaii, has been considered home for many over the past few days as wildfires swept through the island.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Aid and food are distributed here for people who have lost virtually everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some wait anxiously to hear news of missing friends and relatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At least 4,500 people have lost their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For residents, rebuilding their lives and homes is unthinkable right now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We lost everything. Thank God that we still have each other and we're all alive and safe and counted for. It's like we're the only things we have now because everything that we had in the past is gone. On top of the emotional turmoil, material losses are huge. Early estimated costs of rebuilding stand at 5.5 billion US dollars, or 6 billion euros, making the wildfires among the worst disaster in the state's history and the deadliest. More than 90 people have died in the wildfires and authorities expect that number to rise. Veronica Saral, the now widow of Centro's presidential candidate Fernando Villavencio,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: killed last week allegedly by organized crime, has blamed the state for her husband's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: She denounced a lack of protection measures after her husband was shot several times while leaving a rally at a school in Quinto on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They didn't protect him as they should have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The state was in charge of Fernando's security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The state is the direct responsible for the murder of my husband, Fernando Villavicencio.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The state still has to give many answers to everything that happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Currently, six Colombians have been ordered to preventive detention, accused of being alleged hitmen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's still not clear who is behind the shooting. Authorities moved gang leader Jose Adolfo Macias into a maximum security prison on Saturday. The Abencio had accused the Los Choneros boss of threatening him and his campaign just days before he was killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three people have died in a fire at a five-story building in the southern French town of Grasse on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The fire was quickly extinguished, according to the firefighters, and a security cordon has been set up in the town square where the building is located.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In addition to the three victims, three people were seriously injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Four also have minor injuries, according to the emergency services report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Grasse prosecutor's office reported that an investigation is ongoing to determine the origin of the disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A 44-year-old Italian male prisoner was found dead in his cell at Rosano Jail in Calabria

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Sources say the man is believed to have taken his own life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His alleged suicide comes on the heels of the death of two female inmates at Le Valete prison in Turin on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Detention centers are often cited as being overcrowded, an issue Justice Minister Carlo Nordio wishes to tackle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Prison suicides are all too common in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This year has seen 42 prison suicides on top of 85 in 2022. italy coach roberto mancini surprisingly resigned on sunday ending an up-and-down five-year tenure with the national team the 58-year-old was appointed after la squadra surra failed to qualify for the 2018 world cup mancini was able to get his players back to winning ways and root to a hard-fought win on penalties against England during the final of the Euro 2020 at Wembley.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The national side went on a world-record 37-game unbeaten run, but they failed to qualify for the 2022 World Cup.
